It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves, which are a typical feature of sclerophyllous plants adapted to dry environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or reddish in color. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
